flow.descriptionCdata:
bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.43ca4386-2a2e-4bba-ac2e-4bfccfe7b884.description=f63959fa-4bdd-4a0c-ab89-3a9e8a4ec763.218ba8cf-b576-408c-8ec1-5e9a22396034.description bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.5361076f-a564-4109-827d-97a8282f00ca.description=Description\: 

This step updates the server.xml configuration file for Tomcat Server.

Return Code\:

0 \= Step ran successfully
1 \= Step failed.

Inputs\:
 command - executes TomcatSoftwareUpdateStandAloneconfiguration.py
 Custom KeyStore PassPhrase - The password required for the custom keystore, specified as 
"-storepass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom KeyStore Path - Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mykeystore.jks
 Custom PrivateKey PassPhrase - The password required to retrieve the private key from the keystore, specified as "-keypass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom TrustStore PassPhrase - The password required for the custom truststore.
 Custom TrustStore Path - Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mytruststore.jks
 Domain Location - No description
 Download Location - The location where the Java and Tomcat binaries will be downloaded and kept in the target machine.
 Enable SSL - A flag that denotes if SSL has to be enabled in server.xml based on the user keystore details input.
 HostName - Required\: Fully qualified hostname or IP address of the system to be installed
 Java Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to the compressed software package on the target machine.
 Java Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Java can run out of.
 Tomcat Admin Password - *Optional\: Tomcat Admin user password which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
Default password\: admin
 Tomcat Admin User - *Optional\: Tomcat Admin user which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
 Tomcat Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to the compressed software package on the target machine.
 Tomcat Group - Required\: The Group to which the Tomcat user belongs.
 Tomcat Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Tomcat should run run on the system.
 Tomcat Instance AJP Port - Custom AJP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 9009
 Tomcat Instance HTTP Port - Custom HTTP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18000
 Tomcat Instance Name - Tomcat Instance name that should be provisioned under the given domain as specified by 'Domain Location' parameter. Example\: TomcatInstance1
 Tomcat Instance SSL Port - Custom SSL port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18444
 Tomcat User - The Tomcat Instance User under a domain
 Tomcat User Password - The password for 'Tomcat User' parameter
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Instance Home - The Tomcat Instance Home under a domain
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.5f470d70-f2bc-4344-a5e2-66a22754484e.description=Description\:

This step checks to ensure that the archive file exists. Then, based on the archive file extension, extracts the archive to the specified directory.

Return Code\:

0 \= Step ran successfully
1 \= Step failed.

Inputs\:
 command - executes TomcatSoftwareandJavaExtractArchives.py
 Call Wrapper - Required\: Command that will execute the step as a specific user (by default, sudo su - root /opt/hp/dma/client/bin/jython.sh on UNIX targets and jython running as Administrator on Windows targets).
 Install Dir - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Tomcat and Java should run on the system.
 Java Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to the compressed Java software package on the target machine.
 Tomcat Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to compressed Tomcat software package on the target machine.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Java Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to Java
 Tomcat Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Tomcat can run out of.
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.6afdfb26-f226-47f9-a9ed-5a3d06acd3ef.description=Description\: 

This step starts the standalone Apache Tomcat Server.

Dependencies\:

Installed Tomcat Server

Return Code\:

0 \= Step ran successfully
1 \= Step failed.

Inputs\:
 command - executes TomcatSoftwareStandAloneStartServer.py
 Call Wrapper - Required\: Command that will execute the step as a specific user (by default, sudo su - root /opt/hp/dma/client/bin/jython.sh on UNIX targets and jython running as Administrator on Windows targets).
 Instance Home - The Tomcat Instance Home under a domain
 Java Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Java can run out of.
 Tomcat User - Required \: The user under which the Tomcat server will run .
Example\: tomcat. The user will be created if not present and the password for the newly created user can be set using 'Tomcat User Password' parameter. If this password is left blank, the 'Tomcat User' value is used as password.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.9ad8d2f4-bb9b-48a6-b181-3f0f642ab910.description=Description\:

This step validates the extracted JDK and Tomcat archives and fails the workflow if there are any errors.

Return Code\:

0 \= Step ran successfully
1 \= Step failed.

Inputs\:
 command - executes ValidateTomcatSoftwareExtractedArchives.py
 Call Wrapper - Optional\: Command that will execute the step as a specific user (by default, sudo su - root /opt/hp/dma/client/bin/jython.sh on UNIX targets and jython running as Administrator on Windows targets).
 Java Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Java can run out of.
 Tomcat Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Tomcat can run out of.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.a35668a1-1141-4f07-a742-25ee9a89c036.description=f63959fa-4bdd-4a0c-ab89-3a9e8a4ec763.7492a424-96df-4464-a278-50dcdb7007c9.description bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.bbf676f0-89c0-4d1d-a4cc-936f77b531f1.description=Description\: 

This step gathers the advanced input parameters from the user for Tomcat Provisioning.

Inputs\:
 command - executes GatherAdvancedParametersforProvisioningTomcatSoftware.py
 Clean on Failure - Optional\: Flag that determines whether to clean up on workflow failure. If set to 'True', the workflow will clean up the downloaded files. Valid values are 'True' and 'False'. The default value is 'True'.
 Clean on Success - Optional\: Flag that determines whether to clean up on workflow success. If set to 'True', the workflow will clean up the downloaded files. Valid values are 'True' and 'False'. The default value is 'True'.
 Custom KeyStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom keystore, specified as "-storepass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom KeyStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mykeystore.jks
Note\: If this value is provided then 'Custom KeyStore PassPhrase' and 'Custom PrivateKey PassPhrase' are required.
If this field is left blank, SSL will not be enabled in Tomcat.
 Custom PrivateKey PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required to retrieve the private key from the keystore, specified as "-keypass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom TrustStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom truststore.
 Custom TrustStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mytruststore.jks
 Tomcat Admin Password - Optional\: Tomcat Admin user password which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
Default password\: admin
 Tomcat Admin User - Optional\: Tomcat Admin user which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
 Tomcat Instance AJP Port - Optional\: Custom AJP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 9009
 Tomcat Instance HTTP Port - Optional\: Custom HTTP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18080
 Tomcat Instance SSL Port - Optional\: Custom SSL port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18444. Note\: The Keystore details have to be provided in order to enable SSL
 Tomcat User Password - Optional\:The password for 'Tomcat User' parameter.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Call Wrapper - No description
 Clean on Failure - Optional\: Flag that determines whether to clean up on workflow failure. If set to 'True', the workflow will clean up the downloaded files. Valid values are 'True' and 'False'. The default value is 'True'.
 Clean on Success - Optional\: Flag that determines whether to clean up on workflow success. If set to 'True', the workflow will clean up the downloaded files. Valid values are 'True' and 'False'. The default value is 'True'.
 Custom KeyStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom keystore, specified as 
"-storepass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom KeyStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mykeystore.jks
 Custom PrivateKey PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required to retrieve the private key from the keystore, specified as "-keypass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom TrustStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom truststore.
 Custom TrustStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mytruststore.jks
 Tomcat Admin Password - Optional\: Tomcat Admin user password which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
 Tomcat Admin User - Optional\: Tomcat Admin user which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
 Tomcat Instance AJP Port - Optional\: Custom AJP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 9009
 Tomcat Instance HTTP Port - Optional\: Custom HTTP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18000
 Tomcat Instance SSL Port - Optional\: Custom SSL port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18444. Note\: The Keystore details have to be provided in order to enable SSL
 Tomcat User Password - Optional\:The password for 'Tomcat User' parameter
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.bd356ecb-4db1-4191-abb1-ad4b812c7e57.description=Description\:

This step performs the following actions to facilitate the execution
of subsequent steps in the workflow\:

(1) Sets the Call Wrapper parameter to its default value. The Call
 Wrapper is the command that executes a step as a specific user.

 Default for UNIX targets is\: sudo su - root /opt/hp/dma/client/bin/jython.sh

 Default for Windows targets is\: jython

(2) Allows certain parameters that may or may not be required depending
 on what the end user wants to do to be hidden or exposed.

Dependencies\: None

Return Code\:

0 \= Step ran successfully
1 \= Step failed.

Inputs\:
 command - executes GatherParametersforProvisioningTomcatSoftware.py
 Domain Location - Required\: The path to Tomcat Domain Location.Example\: /apps/GTS/domain
Where GTS can represent the Line of Business or Department.
 Download Location - Required\: The location where the Java and Tomcat binaries will be downloaded and kept in the target machine.
 Install Dir - Required\: Fully qualified path of location to uncompress binaries of both Java and Tomcat.
 Java Binary Archive - Required\: Required\: Name of the compressed Java software package. [Example\: jdk-7u71-linux-x64.gz ]. If the Java software package is not available in the target machine, then it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in Download Location.
For Windows\: The JDK has to be pre-installed before running this workflow.Please provide the complete path to JDK installation. For example\: C\:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_80
 Tomcat Binary Archive - Required\: Name of the Tomcat software package. [Example\: apache-tomcat-7.0.64.tar.gz]. If the Tomcat software package is not available in the target machine, then it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in Download Location.
 Tomcat Group - Required\: The Group to which the Tomcat user belongs. For Windows\: Currently creating group is not supported.
 Tomcat Instance Name - Required\: Tomcat Instance name that should be provisioned under the given domain as specified by 'Domain Location' parameter. Example\: TomcatInstance1
 Tomcat User - Required \: The user under which the Tomcat server will run . 
Example\: tomcat. The user will be created if not present and the password for the newly created user can be set using 'Tomcat User Password' parameter. If this password is left blank, the 'Tomcat User' value is used as password.For Windows\: Currently creating users is not supported.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Call Wrapper - Required\: Command that will execute the step as a specific user (by default, sudo su - root /opt/hp/dma/client/bin/jython.sh for UNIX targets and jython for Windows targets).
 Domain Location - Required\: The path to Tomcat Domain Location. Example\: /apps/GTS/domain Where GTS can represent the Line of Business or Department.
 Download Location - Required\: The location where the Java and Tomcat binaries will be downloaded and kept in the target machine.
 Install Dir - Required\: Fully qualified path of location to uncompress binaries of both Java and Tomcat.
 Java Binary Archive - Required\: Name of the compressed Java software package. [Example\: jdk-7u71-linux-x64.gz ]. If the Java software package is not available in the target machine, then it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in Download Location.
For Windows\: The JDK has to be pre-installed before running this workflow.Please provide the complete path to JDK installation. For example\: C\:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_80
 Tomcat Binary Archive - Required\: Name of the Tomcat software package. [Example\: apache-tomcat-7.0.64.tar.gz]. If the Tomcat software package is not available in the target machine, then it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in Download Location.
 Tomcat Group - Required\: The Group to which the Tomcat user belongs. For Windows\: Currently creating group is not supported.
 Tomcat Instance Name - Required\: Tomcat Instance name that should be provisioned under the given domain as specified by 'Domain Location' parameter. Example\: TomcatInstance1
 Tomcat User - Required \: The user under which the Tomcat server will run . 
Example\: tomcat. The user will be created if not present and the password for the newly created user can be set using 'Tomcat User Password' parameter. If this password is left blank, the 'Tomcat User' value is used as password.For Windows\: Currently creating users is not supported.
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.d6761a37-fc7c-420d-bee3-42ecd4300cef.description=f63959fa-4bdd-4a0c-ab89-3a9e8a4ec763.94a138f1-3023-450c-aee8-8b830e3349fe.description bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.description=<pre>
 Purpose

This workflow installs a new instance of Apache Tomcat Server version 8.x


 Support Matrix

Tomcat Version 8.x and JDK 1.7 and higher.


 
For a list of the specific OS versions supported, refer to the _HP Database and Middleware Automation Support Matrix_ (see Additional Documentation below).

 Dependencies

This workflow requires unchallenged sudo access to a user (typically root) who can access all required files and directories.
The workflow requires a minimum of JDK 1.7

 Results Verification

The Console will indicate whether the workflow completed without errors. The workflow results will indicate whether the installation was successful.



 Additional Documentation

Additional information, including the _HP Database and Middleware Automation Support Matrix_ and solution pack user guides, are available via HP Live Network\:

"http\://hpln.hp.com/group/database-and-middleware-automation"\:http\://hpln.hp.com/group/database-and-middleware-automation

To access the documentation, click the RESOURCES link and enter your HP Passport credentials.
 Required Inputs

 Server Target - The desired target to run this flow against.
 Server Target Username - The user to login to the Server Target as.
 Server Target Password - The password to login as the Server Target Username.
 Download Source Host - The target host where the files needed for this flow can be downloaded from.
 Download Source Path - The path to where the files can be found on the Download Source Host.
 Domain Location - Required\: The path to Tomcat Domain Location.Example\: /apps/GTS/domain
Where GTS can represent the Line of Business or Department.
 Download Location - Required\: The location where the Java and Tomcat binaries will be downloaded and kept in the target machine.
 HostName - Required\: Fully qualified hostname or IP address of the system to be installed
 Install Dir - Required\: Fully qualified path of location to uncompress binaries of both Java and Tomcat.
 Java Binary Archive - Required\: Required\: Name of the compressed Java software package. [Example\: jdk-7u71-linux-x64.gz ]. If the Java software package is not available in the target machine, then it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in Download Location.
For Windows\: The JDK has to be pre-installed before running this workflow.Please provide the complete path to JDK installation. For example\: C\:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_80
 Server.Become Routine - No description
 Tomcat Binary Archive - Required\: Name of the Tomcat software package. [Example\: apache-tomcat-7.0.64.tar.gz]. If the Tomcat software package is not available in the target machine, then it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in Download Location.
 Tomcat Group - Required\: The Group to which the Tomcat user belongs. For Windows\: Currently creating group is not supported.
 Tomcat Instance Name - Required\: Tomcat Instance name that should be provisioned under the given domain as specified by 'Domain Location' parameter. Example\: TomcatInstance1
 Tomcat User - Required \: The user under which the Tomcat server will run . 
Example\: tomcat. The user will be created if not present and the password for the newly created user can be set using 'Tomcat User Password' parameter. If this password is left blank, the 'Tomcat User' value is used as password.For Windows\: Currently creating users is not supported.

 Optional Inputs

 Clean Code Base - Remove code base from target after execution (True || False).
 Clean JRE - Remove JRE from target after execution (True || False).
 Download From SA - Download binaries from SA (True || False). Must set override for 'SAUser' System Account.
 SA Folder Path - Location of binaries on SA. Must set override for 'SAUser' System Account.
 Debug Level - Set level of output [(least) 1-5 (most)]
 Clean on Success - Optional\: Flag that determines whether to clean up on workflow success. If set to 'True', the workflow will clean up the downloaded files. Valid values are 'True' and 'False'. The default value is 'True'.
 Tomcat User Password - Optional\:The password for 'Tomcat User' parameter.
 Tomcat Home - Optional\: Fully qualified path to where Tomcat can run out of.
 Tomcat Instance HTTP Port - Optional\: Custom HTTP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18080
 Tomcat Admin Password - Optional\: Tomcat Admin user password which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
Default password\: admin
 Custom KeyStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mykeystore.jks
Note\: If this value is provided then 'Custom KeyStore PassPhrase' and 'Custom PrivateKey PassPhrase' are required.
If this field is left blank, SSL will not be enabled in Tomcat.
 Clean on Failure - Optional\: Flag that determines whether to clean up on workflow failure. If set to 'True', the workflow will clean up the downloaded files. Valid values are 'True' and 'False'. The default value is 'True'.
 Custom TrustStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mytruststore.jks
 Custom TrustStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom truststore.
 Custom KeyStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom keystore, specified as "-storepass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom PrivateKey PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required to retrieve the private key from the keystore, specified as "-keypass" argument to keytool command.
 Tomcat Instance SSL Port - Optional\: Custom SSL port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18444. Note\: The Keystore details have to be provided in order to enable SSL
 Tomcat Instance AJP Port - Optional\: Custom AJP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 9009
 Tomcat Admin User - Optional\: Tomcat Admin user which is used to access the Administration Console.The users are maintained in a file called tomcat-users.xml under conf.
</pre> bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.e0cd8473-4072-44e7-a840-455213556e37.description=Description\:

This step validates the parameters needed to install a Tomcat Application Server in standalone mode.

Return Code\:

0 \= Step ran successfully
1 \= Step failed.

Inputs\:
 command - executes ValidateParametersForProvisioningTomcatSoftware.py
 Call Wrapper - Optional\: Command that will execute the step as a specific user (by default, sudo su - root /opt/hp/dma/client/bin/jython.sh on UNIX targets and jython running as Administrator on Windows targets).
 Custom KeyStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom keystore, specified as "-storepass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom KeyStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mykeystore.jks
 Custom PrivateKey PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required to retrieve the private key from the keystore, specified as "-keypass" argument to keytool command.
 Custom TrustStore PassPhrase - Optional\: The password required for the custom truststore.
 Custom TrustStore Path - Optional\: Fully qualified path to the custom trust store file.
Example\: /opt/tomcat/apache-tomcat-8.0.27/conf/mytruststore.jks
 Domain Location - Required\: The path to Tomcat Domain Location. Example\: /apps/GTS/domain Where GTS can represent the Line of Business or Department.
 Download Location - The location where the Java and Tomcat binaries will be downloaded and kept in the target machine.
 HostName - Required\: Fully qualified hostname or IP address of the system to be installed
 Install Dir - Optional\: Fully qualified path of location to uncompress Java and Tomcat binaries.
 Java Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to where the compressed Java software package should be on the target machine. If the Java software package is not available in this location it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in this location.
 Tomcat Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to where the compressed Tomcat software package should be on the target machine. If the Tomcat software package is not available in this location it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in this location.
 Tomcat Group - Required\: The Group to which the Tomcat user belongs.
 Tomcat Instance AJP Port - Custom AJP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 9009
 Tomcat Instance HTTP Port - Custom HTTP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18000
 Tomcat Instance Name - Tomcat Instance name that should be provisioned under the given domain as specified by 'Domain Location' parameter. Example\: TomcatInstance1
 Tomcat Instance SSL Port - Custom SSL port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18444
 Tomcat User - Required \: The user under which the Tomcat server will run . 
Example\: tomcat. The user will be created if not present and the password for the newly created user can be set using 'Tomcat User Password' parameter. If this password is left blank, the 'Tomcat User' value is used as password.
 Tomcat User Password - The password for 'Tomcat User' parameter.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Call Wrapper - Optional\: Command that will execute the step as a specific user (by default, sudo su - root /opt/hp/dma/client/bin/jython.sh on UNIX targets and jython running as Administrator on Windows targets).
 Domain Location - Required\: The path to Tomcat Domain Location. Example\: /apps/GTS/domain Where GTS can represent the Line of Business or Department.
 Enable SSL - A flag that denotes if SSL has to be enabled in server.xml based on the user keystore details input.
 File List - Optional\: List of fully qualified files to download
 HostName - Required\: Fully qualified hostname or IP address of the system to be installed
 Install Dir - Optional\: Fully qualified path of location to uncompress Java and Tomcat binaries.
 Java Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to where the compressed Java software package should be on the target machine. If the Java software package is not available in this location it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in this location.
 Tomcat Binary Archive - Required\: Fully qualified path to where the compressed Tomcat software package should be on the target machine. If the Tomcat software package is not available in this location it will be downloaded from the software repository and placed in this location.
 Tomcat Group - Required\: The Group to which the Tomcat user belongs.
 Tomcat Instance AJP Port - Custom AJP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 9009
 Tomcat Instance HTTP Port - Custom HTTP port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18000
 Tomcat Instance Name - Tomcat Instance name that should be provisioned under the given domain as specified by 'Domain Location' parameter. Example\: TomcatInstance1
 Tomcat Instance SSL Port - Custom SSL port for TomcatInstance. Example\: 18444
 Tomcat User - Required \: The user under which the Tomcat server will run . 
Example\: tomcat. The user will be created if not present and the password for the newly created user can be set using 'Tomcat User Password' parameter. If this password is left blank, the 'Tomcat User' value is used as password.
 Tomcat User Password - The password for 'Tomcat User' parameter.
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.e12513ca-c51c-40b0-adb5-36aeb5c9a661.description=f63959fa-4bdd-4a0c-ab89-3a9e8a4ec763.2e92abe7-7c25-46b6-8a3a-2e2bf7b8aae9.description bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.ed4a0d41-e323-43d3-b0e6-d0bf7807bbcd.description=Description\:

Remove all downloaded files and archives.

Dependencies\: Run as file/directory owner.

Return Code\:

0 \= All files were removed from the system.
1 \= Errors occurred while removing files.

Inputs\:
 command - executes CleanupDownloadedFilesv2.py
 Call Wrapper - *Required\: The jython call wrapper required to run as the owner of the files/directories.
 Cleanup - No description
 Do Not Remove List - *Optional\: List of directories that should not be removed.
 Download File List - *Optional\: List of file downloaded from the Nerve Center
 Download Location - Location temp files were downloaded.
 Temporary File Location - *Optional\: The location where all temporary output files will be placed.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.f313e55d-2def-49c5-a14f-8040baccd58a.description=Purpose\:
Check for the existence of a file before downloading from Expert Engine.
 - Check if file is in the expected place.
 - If file is not in the expected location, output data for file download.
 ** Note that the "Target Directory" parameter is set to the directory of
 the first file in the list not found. **

Inputs\:
 command - executes CheckFileDownload.py
 File List - List of comma separated fully qualified pathnames to check.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Download List - Comma separated list of files not found.
 File List - List of comma separated fully qualified pathnames checked.
 Present List - Comma separated list of files found.
 Target Directory - The directory name of the first file not found.
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
 bd071cb7-d8be-49df-92b9-17668d158a6d.f67e8dd2-0b00-4d30-aa30-964c061a7555.description=Description\:

Remove all downloaded files and archives.

Dependencies\: Run as file/directory owner.

Return Code\:

0 \= All files were removed from the system.
1 \= Errors occurred while removing files.

Inputs\:
 command - executes CleanupDownloadedFilesv2.py
 Call Wrapper - *Required\: The jython call wrapper required to run as the owner of the files/directories.
 Cleanup - No description
 Do Not Remove List - *Optional\: List of directories that should not be removed.
 Download File List - *Optional\: List of file downloaded from the Nerve Center
 Download Location - Location temp files were downloaded.
 Temporary File Location - *Optional\: The location where all temporary output files will be placed.
 host - Target to run this command against
 password - Login information for host
 username - Login information for host
 protocol - ssh/wmi
 timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen.

Results\:
 Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
